Description: BostonGene uses artificial intelligence and machine learning systems to integrate data from next-generation DNA and RNA sequencing (NGS), multiplex imaging, and flow cytometry to paint a comprehensive portrait of a cancer patient's tumor and immune system. This 360-degree approach to precision diagnostics requires the deployment of novel analytical solutions. BostonGene will present how harmonizing Agilent-supported NGS techniques with production-scale research bioinformatics powered the development of the Tumor Immunity Portrait, a CAP/CLIA-certified platform that provides the most detailed reconstruction of the tumor microenvironment to date. Currently providing robust solutions from clinical decision support to patient stratification for immunotherapy clinical trials.
SearchResultBody: ESP01C. Next Generation Immunotherapy Response Prediction Driven by BostonGene’s Bioinformatic Engine Through AI-Based Multiomic Data Integration
Title: Next Generation Immunotherapy Response Prediction Driven by BostonGene’s Bioinformatic Engine Through AI-Based Multiomic Data Integration
